results.title: Roman fact, Roman fable
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Romans in Britain”.
The first installment of the Roman’s in Britain Series discusses the history of Britain in relation to the Roman invasion and occupation of its shores over a number of centuries. The program explores the tribal groups that previously occupied the area and the systematic take over that the Romans succeeded in achieving in AD43 and the subsequent impact this had on the cultural and societal life of the previous inhabitants. Through thorough narration, interviews with historians and archaeologists, reenactments, reconstructions of archaeological findings and excerpts from film and television depictions of this historical period the various myths, facts and speculations about this time in history are explored and analysed with a view to creating an accurate perspective on the classical past in Britain and the Roman impact on the country that is still visible today.

group_siblings.title: Hadrian's Wall: the edge of empire

results.title: Roman coins = Moneta Romana
results.brief_description: Shows Roman coins produced during the 5th century BC and succeeding centuries, depicting the grandeur and fall of Rome and the qualities of its emperors and leaders. The coins show that money was needed everywhere to build colosseums, for state funerals and for negotiations with Africa, Spain and Gallia. It was the Senate that decided to replace the small bronze coins with silver ones. Commentary in Italian.

results.title: Roman art and architecture
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hearst and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Grandeur that Was Rome”.
A discussion of ancient Rome’s art and architecture, particularly of functional constructions such as aqueducts, and of domes and large interiors.

results.title: Roma = Fellini's Roma
results.creator_credit: Ultra Films, Turi Vasile and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: Fellini’s personal vision of Rome mixes travelogue, nostalgia fantasy, comedy and documentary. Inspired by his remembrances of his childhood and his sharp observations about contemporary Roman life in the seventies, the film fondly lingers over the “Felliniesque” carnival of characters populating family dinners, theater audiences, brothels, and street parties. Fellini turns Rome’s Catholic ritualism into an opulent ecclesiastical fashion show, while the subway construction sequence and the final, nocturnal tour of the ruins via motorcycle find surreal beauty in the potentially destructive juxtaposition of ancient and modern Rome. Cast includes Peter Gonzales, Fiona Florence, Marni Maitland, Anna Magnani, Federico Fellini and Gore Vidal. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Roma
results.creator_credit: Barbara Lemon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Barbara Lemon pays tribute to her grandmother; cheeky, fiesty, caring and resilient. From growing up in Warrigal during the war to the birth of her great grandchildren, Roma has seen a lot in her 102 years and is more than happy to share her stories with her family.

results.title: Rolling Stones: time is on our side
results.brief_description: Video recording of the Rolling Stones performing at the Sun Devil Stadium, Arizona State University, Arizona, as part of their American Tour 81. Includes some of their most popular songs but the performance is probably not one of their best and the recording is of inconsistent quality.

results.title: Rolling Stone: 20 Years of Rock N' Roll
results.brief_description: This video includes interviews with: Mick Jagger, George Harrison, Jerry Garcia, Sting, David Bowie, Tina Turner, Joni Mitchell, Lou Reed, George Clinton, Robbie Robertson, Aretha Franklin, David Byrne, Smokey Robinson, and Dennis Hopper. It also features performances by: The Beatles, Jefferson Airplane, Otis Redding, The Police, Aretha Franklin, The Who, Bob Dylan, The Band, The Rolling Stones, The Doors, Led Zeppelin, T Rex, David Bowie, Bruce Springsteen, Jackson Browne, and The Eagles.

results.title: Rollergirl

results.title: Rollerball
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation and Norman Jewison
results.brief_description: The next war not will be fought - it will be played. The year is 2018. There are no wars. There is no crime. There is only “The Game”. In a world ruled by Corporations, where no-one asks questions, the vicious barbaric “sport” of Rollerball distracts the masses and satisfies their violent and potentially rebellious impulses. Jonathon E., (James Caan), is the champion Rollerball player, but in a world governed by an elite, there is no place for an individual, let alone an icon of heroic achievement. Threatened by the head of the Corporation, (John Houseman), deprived of the woman he loves, (Maud Adams), Jonathan E. must make the choice to “quit while he’s ahead” or suffer the consequences. In an arena, where there are no rules, there can only be one winner. A sci-fi thriller with a chilling climax.
